channel.title: Cant connect to my server
channel.description:
Im running the server. Ive port fowarded. Ive made the ip 0.0.0.0 like the creator said to do. I still get an error connecting to server. Heres one thing though. When i search "server =", there are 2 server ips. Was i suposse to make one 0.0.0.0 and one the server ip? If so, which one do i make the server ip, and which one do i make 0.0.0.0? This is actually a SERVER problem mods, not a CLIENT problem. Well, its slightly both. But more of a server problem.
Theres a ip in the client in the source, i changed that into 0.0.0.0 Was i suposse to do that?
I posted this last night, didnt get any responses.

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @i0wn3v3ry i0wn3v3ry
item.description:
@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

127.0.0.1 & 0.0.0.0 are both “Localhost”.

If they’re is 2 Server ='s, in your client, I’m sure one of them is commented out with a //.
Then you should change the one that isn’t commented out.
If you’re wanting other people to be able to connect, change is to your no-ip, but if you’re trying to connect, use the localhost ip’s.

Read full topic

item.description:
@weed4u wrote:

[quote=“xxxtilllyxxx, post:3, topic:389834”]Change it to 127.0.0.1 or your no-ip, changing it to 0.0.0.0 does nothing but fuck your server, and weed4u dont fucking post if you cant help. 3rd time ive had to change what you said.[/quote]\

umm stfu. thats the same thing i said. besides the part where it will work on 127.0.0.1. because its local host

item.title: Cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @weed4u weed4u
item.description:
@weed4u wrote:

there are no ip’s or local hosts in the server files. its in the client files so don’t say that its not, search “127.0.0.1” in the client and see what you get. if that doesn’t work search “no-ip” and if you find any of those in the CLIENT files then change them to your ip/no-ip.

Read full topic
